name: Color Picker (Johan Helsing)
description:
The game may have turned out harder than I intended: Click here for hints if you're stuck
  • You start in a very dark room (3D) looking directly at a white thing, walk forwards with W to pick it up.
  • If you get stuck finding the last color of the fourth palette (squares), try following the path into the shadow.
  • From the starting area, follow the path on the ground straight forward into the shadow. You should see a new color to your right.

3D first-person controls: Use arrow keys or WASD to move, mouse for looking.

Switch colors with the mouse buttons (but you need a full palette first).

If it's slow in the browser or the audio doesn't work, please consider downloading instead.

Credits
  • Music by Ted Kerr - which was not made for the jam.
  • Skybox: kloppenheim_06 from HDRIHaven.
  • Font: Quicksand by Andrew Paglinawan
  • Palettes: Twilight 5, Beach-Front
Post-jam updates
  • Mac and Linux builds
  • Windows: Fixed floating point rounding issue that caused clues to turn invisible

Made in three days for Mini Jam 73. Theme: "Power", limitation: "Only 5 collors"
